headline: EU warns Meta it must open up WhatsApp to rival AI chatbots
summary: The EU executive on Monday told Meta to give rival chatbots access to WhatsApp after an antitrust probe found the US giant to be in breach of the bloc's competition rules. The EU executive, which is in charge of competition policy, sent Meta a warning known as a "statement of objections", a formal step in antitrust probes.

content.title: EU warns Meta it must open up WhatsApp to rival AI chatbots
content.summary: The EU executive on Monday told Meta to give rival chatbots access to WhatsApp after an antitrust probe found the US giant to be in breach of the bloc's competition rules. The EU executive, which is in charge of competition policy, sent Meta a warning known as a "statement of objections", a formal step in antitrust probes.

thumbnail.caption: The European Commission launched an antitrust probe over WhatsApp AI features in December 2025 (Kirill KUDRYAVTSEV)

headline: EU threatens Meta with interim measure for blocking AI rivals from WhatsApp
summary: BRUSSELS, Feb 9 () - EU competition regulators on Monday charged Meta ​Platforms with breaching antitrust rules ‌by blocking artificial intelligence rivals from its ‌messaging service WhatsApp and threatened to impose interim measures against the U. The move by the European ⁠Commission came ‌after Meta implemented its policy on January 15 allowing only ‍its AI assistant Meta AI on WhatsApp.

headline: Just How Big Is the AI Spending Spree?
summary: $670 billion That's how much Microsoft, Meta, Amazon and Alphabet’s Google unit plan to spend on building out AI infrastructure this year. As a share of the economy, AI outlays now outstrip the railroad expansion of the 1850s or the Apollo space program that put astronauts on the moon in the 1960s.

content.title: Just How Big Is the AI Spending Spree?
content.summary: $670 billion That's how much Microsoft, Meta, Amazon and Alphabet’s Google unit plan to spend on building out AI infrastructure this year. headline: Heard on the Street Friday Recap: Blue-Chip Rally
summary: Nvidia and Caterpillar were the Dow's top gainers, rising nearly 8% and 7.1% respectively.  The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq composite each gained roughly 2%, following three days of declines.  Amazon joined the AI spending party.

content.title: Heard on the Street Friday Recap: Blue-Chip Rally
content.summary: Nvidia and Caterpillar were the Dow's top gainers, rising nearly 8% and 7.1% respectively.  The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq composite each gained roughly 2%, following three days of declines.  Amazon joined the AI spending party.

headline: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy Warns Shoppers Are 'Starting To See More Of That Impact' As Trump's 10% Tariffs Begin Hitting Prices On Amazon
summary: Price changes are beginning to appear across Amazon's marketplace. Shoppers are "starting to see more of that impact" as tariff-related costs begin to show up in prices, Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) CEO Andy Jassy told CNBC last month at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland. "This year, people are thinking about lots of things, but top of mind for many of us, including one of the world's largest retailers, is pricing pressure on consumers amid the Trump administration's tariff agenda," he said

headline: EU Says Meta Warning Is About Protecting Consumers
summary: European Union Competition Commissioner Teresa Ribera discusses the EU's warning given to Meta Platforms Inc. over policies that block the use of rival Artificial Intelligence assistants on WhatsApp, raising the possibility of further tensions with the Trump administration over the regulation of US tech companies. Speaking on Bloomberg Television, Ribera also comments on Google's ad tech business and Netflix and Paramount's battle over Warner Bros. Discovery.

content.title: EU Says Meta Warning Is About Protecting Consumers
content.description: European Union Competition Commissioner Teresa Ribera discusses the EU's warning given to Meta Platforms Inc. over policies that block the use of rival Artificial Intelligence assistants on WhatsApp, raising the possibility of further tensions with the Trump administration over the regulation of US tech companies. Speaking on Bloomberg Television, Ribera also comments on Google's ad tech business and Netflix and Paramount's battle over Warner Bros. Discovery.
content.summary: European Union Competition Commissioner Teresa Ribera discusses the EU's warning given to Meta Platforms Inc. over policies that block the use of rival Artificial Intelligence assistants on WhatsApp, raising the possibility of further tensions with the Trump administration over the regulation of US tech companies. Speaking on Bloomberg Television, Ribera also comments on Google's ad tech business and Netflix and Paramount's battle over Warner Bros. Discovery.

headline: Peter Thiel Once Said Brilliant Thinking Is 'Rare' But Even Rarer And In 'Shorter Supply' Is This Personality Trait
summary: Venture capitalist and Palantir (NASDAQ:PLTR) chairman Peter Thiel has long argued that the real bottleneck in innovation isn't brainpower but bravery, the willingness to back an idea most people think is wrong. Thiel Says Genius Means Little Without Courage Speaking in 2015 about his book ‘Zero to One: Notes on Startups, or How to Build the Future’ at an event hosted by the Independent Institute, Thiel said many people are smart enough to spot opportunities, but far fewer are willing to pursue

headline: Meta Hit by EU Warning to Open WhatsApp to Rival AI Chatbots
summary: The European Commission, the bloc’s executive arm, sent a statement of objections to Meta, warning the company it will take measures to avoid “serious and irreparable harm on the market” over its failure to allow access to other AI tools.  The commission said Meta’s conduct “risks blocking competitors from entering or expanding in the rapidly growing market for AI assistants.”

content.title: Meta Hit by EU Warning to Open WhatsApp to Rival AI Chatbots
content.summary: The European Commission, the bloc’s executive arm, sent a statement of objections to Meta, warning the company it will take measures to avoid “serious and irreparable harm on the market” over its failure to allow access to other AI tools.  The commission said Meta’s conduct “risks blocking competitors from entering or expanding in the rapidly growing market for AI assistants.”
